column4: Matboy:  yes Ubuntu is pretty good, but sadly not for all users
: nothing is
: kdesudo kate/path /to/file
say that to bro
: sorry
oh yeah I said gksudo to him didn't I hmm
well thanks I forgot that  Kubuntu has it's own thing as well
he wants to edit his  /boot/grub/menu.lst file
put a timeout back on it, so he can go into  recovery mode and hopefuly fix xorg,  in fact maybe you know of a better way? he is on the Live CD
: not for me I fix my probles with ATI by upgrading from hardy to intepid no problems after that but maybe this not apply to all
Well I am glad that  I use Nividia :)
enough though their driver is propritary closed source
: I believe you
9.04 has been a bad release for Intel graphics card and ATI to some extent as well
: we all use different proprietary packages and nobody seams to have problem with that
the first bit is true, the second bit isn't true
: don´t be purist take world as it is I will like to use free codecs and other stuff but...

I am not purist, but ideally we should be using  opensource/freesoftware rather than closed source software,  it's just sometimes there is a good reason to use closed source, the graphics card driver for example
: I can not agree more we think the same way  ;)
good :)
